content:
Hi.
What is the recommended way to host some crates.io server ? We really need that in our company and I've see its possible to run Crates.io locally, but apparently quite painful experience
There are a couple of unofficial self hosting cargo registry servers AFAICT, but no official one meant for self hosting.

@regis portalez Do you need to clone all of crates.io, or do you just want to host private packages? If you want private hosting, there is a list of solutions at https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/wiki/Third-party-registries

If you want a clone of all of crates.io, there are a number of open-source cloning tools. Just beware that it takes about 40GB.

If you want a clone of all of crates.io, there are a number of open-source cloning tools. Just beware that it takes about 40GB.

If you are downloading a lot of crates at once, should give a heads up to the crates.io team first I think.
It's fine if you download directly from static.crates.io.
This got me wonder is there something like https://dumps.wikimedia.org/ for crates.io?
@Bot+ There is a database dump available here: https://crates.io/data-access
Just to let you know, I found this solution which looks great so far https://www.bitfalter.com/documentation
